intro: Alsine tenuifolia subsp. lydia, commonly known as Lydia’s narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal dunes or rocky habitats. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in certain regions.
